Res. 503) Establishing the Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol.

This resolution sets forth rules for the consideration of

  • H.R. 2662 to amend the Inspector General Act of 1978;
  • H.R. 3005 to direct the Joint Committee on the Library to replace the bust of Chief Justice Roger Brooke Taney with a bust of Justice Thurgood Marshall and to remove statues of individuals who voluntarily served in the Confederacy in the Civil War from the U.S. Capitol;
  • H.R. 3684 to authorize funds for federal-aid highways, highway safety programs, and transit programs; and
  • H. Res. 503 establishing the Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
